definitions: a method of transmitting or receiving data (especially video and audio material) over a computer network as a steady, continuous flow, allowing playback to start while the rest of the data is still being received.
shortDefinitions: method of relaying data over computer network as steady continuous stream

definitions: the practice of putting schoolchildren in groups of the same age and ability to be taught together

examples.text: streaming within secondary schools is common practice

shortDefinitions: practice of putting schoolchildren in groups of same age and ability to be taught together

definitions: relating to or using data transmitted in a continuous stream while earlier parts are being used
shortDefinitions: relating to data transmitted in continuous stream

definitions: relating to or making use of a form of tape transport, used mainly to provide backup storage, in which data may be transferred in bulk while the tape is in motion
shortDefinitions: relating to or making use of form of tape transport

definitions: (of a cold) accompanied by copious running of the nose and eyes
shortDefinitions: denoting cold accompanied by copious running of nose and eyes
